Race.SpecificTitle: City Marshal -- City Court, City of Bogalusa
Councilman -- District A, City of Bogalusa
Councilman -- District B, City of Bogalusa
Councilman -- District E, City of Bogalusa
Fire Protection Dist. No. 7 Prop. #1 -- 5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of five (5) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $112,185 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and paying charges for fire hydrant rentals and service?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 7 Prop. #2 -- 4 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 7, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of four (4) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $89,748 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and paying charges for fire hydrant rentals and service?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 -- $425,000 Bond - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Washington Parish Fire Protection District No. 1, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Four Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($425,000), to run not exceeding fifteen (15) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding six per centum (6%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing and improving buildings, machinery and equipment, including fire stations, to be used in giving fire protection to the property in the District, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated increase of four and thirty-five hundredths mills (4.35) to be levied in the first year of issue above the 6.15 mills currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?
